Docs.summary: Represents support for ASP.NET AJAX within an ASP.NET MVC application.

Docs.param: The AJAX helper.
The inner text of the anchor element.
The name of the action method.
An object that provides options for the asynchronous request.
Docs.summary: Returns an anchor element that contains the URL to the specified action method; when the action link is clicked, the action method is invoked asynchronously by using JavaScript.
Docs.exception: The parameter is null or empty.

The inner text of the anchor element.
The name of the action method.

The host name for the URL.
The URL fragment name (the anchor name).

static member GlobalizationScript : System.Web.Mvc.AjaxHelper -> System.Web.Mvc.MvcHtmlString

Docs.param: The AJAX helper object that this method extends.
Docs.summary: Returns an HTML script element that contains a reference to a globalization script that defines the culture information.
Docs.returns: A script element whose src attribute is set to the globalization script, as in the following example: <script type="text/javascript" src="/MvcApplication1/Scripts/Globalization/en-US.js"></script>

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Web.Mvc.MvcHtmlString GlobalizationScript (this System.Web.Mvc.AjaxHelper ajaxHelper, System.Globalization.CultureInfo cultureInfo);

static member GlobalizationScript : System.Web.Mvc.AjaxHelper * System.Globalization.CultureInfo -> System.Web.Mvc.MvcHtmlString

Docs.param: The AJAX helper object that this method extends.
Encapsulates information about the target culture, such as date formats.
Docs.summary: Returns an HTML script element that contains a reference to a globalization script that defines the specified culture information.
Docs.returns: An HTML script element whose src attribute is set to the globalization script, as in the following example:<script type="text/javascript" src="/MvcApplication1/Scripts/Globalization/en-US.js"></script>
Docs.exception: The parameter is null.

Docs.param: The AJAX helper.
The inner text of the anchor element.

An object that contains the parameters for a route. The parameters are retrieved through reflection by examining the properties of the object. This object is typically created by using object initializer syntax.
An object that provides options for the asynchronous request.
Docs.summary: Returns an anchor element that contains the virtual path for the specified route values; when the link is clicked, a request is made to the virtual path asynchronously by using JavaScript.
Docs.exception: The parameter is null or empty.

MemberSignature.Usage: System.Web.Mvc.Ajax.AjaxExtensions.RouteLink (ajaxHelper, linkText, routeName, protocol, hostName, fragment, routeValues, ajaxOptions, htmlAttributes)

Docs.param: The AJAX helper.
The inner text of the anchor element.
The name of the route to use to obtain the form post URL.
The protocol for the URL, such as "http" or "https".
The host name for the URL.
The URL fragment name (the anchor name).
An object that contains the parameters for a route.
An object that provides options for the asynchronous request.
An object that contains the HTML attributes to set for the element.
Docs.summary: Returns an anchor element that contains the virtual path for the specified route values; when the link is clicked, a request is made to the virtual path asynchronously by using JavaScript.
Docs.exception: The parameter is null or empty.
